TopicTitle: Text input controls craft - a bug that never gets fixed

Articles.Content:
I think this bug has gone long enough. All the way back to .21 ?! Dont know if this is the right place to post this.

http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/1230

Not only this is confirmed no one seems to care?

A workaround is to map action groups to the numeric keypad keys. Then use the the number keys above QWERTY for text input and the numeric keypad for action groups.

You could go further and remap the A-Z hotkeys to something else too (like a joystick or mouse buttons) so that you don't run into problems when you have to type a name or something (for example renaming Kerbal Alarm Clock alarms).

One of the KSP devs mentioned in a dev blog or article that the focus management of the GUI elements are bugged and that they will take care of it in a future update.

It's not just text input which goes the wrong way. Some GUI windows don't prevent click-through. So when you click on a button or something you'll also click on whatever is below the button. It's most notably in the VAB/SPH when using mods. Especially users of infernal robotics know about that.
I never noticed this one? Is it a Linux/Mac thing?

I never noticed this one? Is it a Linux/Mac thing?

It is primarily a Linux thing since the additional keypad is not recognized for text input on linux.
yea its a Linux thing.....the thing is im trying to use a mod called Notes. Its where you use the keyboard A-Z extstesively throughout the flight.
